content.question: Which of the following conclusions is best supported by Pittâ€™s speech?

choices.label: British leaders did not see the French Revolution as a threat.
British leaders strongly desired peace with France.
British leaders saw their country as the strongest opponent of the French Revolution.
British leaders did not want to get involved in continental European affairs.

content.answer: British leaders saw their country as the strongest opponent of the French Revolution.

unit.text: 5: Conflict, Crisis, and Reaction in the Late 18th Century

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Explain how a specific historical development or process is situated within a broader historical context.
